docs.snippet: Andy Murray goes to the dogs, or more precisely the puppies, in a video released on Tuesday which shows him playing at Wimbledon with five cocker spaniels being trained to become sniffer dogs....
docs.lead_paragraph: Andy Murray goes to the dogs, or more precisely the puppies, in a video released on Tuesday which shows him playing at Wimbledon with five cocker spaniels being trained to become sniffer dogs.

headline.main: Andy Murray Plays With Pups in Sniffer-Dog Video
headline.print_headline: Andy Murray Plays With Pups in Sniffer-Dog Video

docs.snippet: A U.N. Security Council vote on a resolution to condemn the Srebrenica massacre as genocide, marking the 20th anniversary of the mass killing, has been delayed until Wednesday as Britain and the United States try to convince Russia not to veto the...
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.N. Security Council vote on a resolution to condemn the Srebrenica massacre as genocide, marking the 20th anniversary of the mass killing, has been delayed until Wednesday as Britain and the United States try to convince Russia not to veto the commemoration, diplomats said.

headline.main: U.N. Srebrenica Vote Delayed in Bid to Avoid Russia Veto-Diplomats
headline.print_headline: U.N. Srebrenica Vote Delayed in Bid to Avoid Russia Veto-Diplomats

docs.snippet: Metropolitan Diary: A routine tow brought the car’s owner, who was riding with the truck operator, a riveting account of the shooting of his brother....
docs.abstract: Metropolitan Diary: A routine tow brought the car’s owner, who was riding with the truck operator, a riveting account of the shooting of his brother.

docs.snippet: The U.N. Security Council delayed a vote on a British-drafted resolution that would condemn the 1995 massacre at Srebrenica during the Bosnian war as "a crime of genocide" until Wednesday after Russia informed council members it would veto the mea...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.N. Security Council delayed a vote on a British-drafted resolution that would condemn the 1995 massacre at Srebrenica during the Bosnian war as "a crime of genocide" until Wednesday after Russia informed council members it would veto the measure.

headline.main: Vote on Srebrenica Resolution Delayed by Russian Veto Threat
headline.print_headline: Vote on Srebrenica Resolution Delayed by Russian Veto Threat

docs.snippet: Serbia's Prime Minister Aleksandar Vucic said on Tuesday his government unanimously agreed to send him to a July 11 commemoration of the 1995 Srebrenica massacre, hours after the United Nations Security Council postponed debate over a resolution t...
docs.lead_paragraph: Serbia's Prime Minister Aleksandar Vucic said on Tuesday his government unanimously agreed to send him to a July 11 commemoration of the 1995 Srebrenica massacre, hours after the United Nations Security Council postponed debate over a resolution to mark the 20th anniversary.

headline.main: Serbia Government Agrees to Send PM to July 11 Srebrenica Commemoration
headline.print_headline: Serbia Government Agrees to Send PM to July 11 Srebrenica Commemoration

docs.snippet: A woman charged in the kidnapping and killing of an Arkansas real estate agent pleaded guilty Tuesday to reduced charges in exchange for agreeing to testify against her estranged husband, who also is charged in the death....
docs.lead_paragraph: A woman charged in the kidnapping and killing of an Arkansas real estate agent pleaded guilty Tuesday to reduced charges in exchange for agreeing to testify against her estranged husband, who also is charged in the death.

headline.main: Arkansas Woman Takes Plea Deal in Slain Realtor Case
headline.print_headline: Arkansas Woman Takes Plea Deal in Slain Realtor Case

docs.snippet: Don’t listen to Justice Scalia. But don’t listen to Justice Breyer, either....
docs.lead_paragraph: Don’t listen to Justice Scalia. But don’t listen to Justice Breyer, either.

docs.snippet: A cast-iron sign locating the birthplace of Mathew B. Brady, a pioneering photographer during the Civil War, was stolen nearly a year ago....
docs.lead_paragraph: A cast-iron sign locating the birthplace of Mathew B. Brady, a pioneering photographer during the Civil War, was stolen nearly a year ago.
docs.abstract: Theft of plaque marking birthplace of 19th-century photojournalist Mathew B Brady in Adirondack town of Johnsburg, NY, has baffled police and angered many residents; Brady is known for capturing horrors of Civil War battlefields, as well as iconic images of Pres Abraham Lincoln.

headline.main: Adirondack Town Mystery: Who Stole Marker for a Civil War Photographer?
headline.print_headline: Town Mystery: Who Stole Marker for a Civil War Photographer?
